items.content_html:
Checklist — To help your pull request get merged faster, please do the following:

    • Provide a summary of your changes — say what problem you are fixing, what files are changed, and what you've done. This doesn't need to be hugely detailed, as we can see exact changes in the "Files changed" tab.
    • Provide a link to the issue(s) you are fixing, if appropriate, in the form "Fixes url-of-issue". GitHub will render this in the form "Fixes #1234", with the issue number linked to the issue. Doing this allows us to figure out what issues you are fixing, as well as helping to automate things (for example the issue will be closed once the PR that fixed it has been merged).
    • Review the results of the automated checking we run on every PR and fix any problems reported (see the list of checks near the bottom of the PR page). If you need help, please ask in a comment!
    • Link to any other resources that you think might be useful in reviewing your PR.
items.title: Fix typo
fix: flaws in web/api/h* batch 1

items.content_html:
There is no need to use a if-else conditional statement when the if branch contains a "throw" clause inside as no statements get executed after that. Keeps the code smaller, clean, less indentation, and more readable.

If this change gets approved you might want to consider search for this pattern on the different files of the MDN guide as it is not the first place I saw it.
items.title: Remove non-reacheable code after a 'throw' clause

items.title: Removed missing images.

items.content_html:
I made text revisions for clarity and one edit for US English spelling (dialogue -> dialog). For readability, I shortened some sentences and eliminated some extraneous wording.

The styling for the unordered lists could use some attention too, but I am focusing on content editing for this PR.
items.title: Update index.html

items.content_html: A note about rel="alternate" was placed under the definition for rel="author" instead.
items.title: Fix incorrectly placed note in rel attribute page

items.content_html:
Move https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentOrShadowRoot/elementFromPoint to http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/elementFromPoint

Move https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentOrShadowRoot/elementsFromPoint to
http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/elementsFromPoint

The spec defines both for Document only: https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom-view/#extensions-to-the-document-interface

Apparently browsers decided to also ship this for ShadowRoot. I'll write a follow-up PR to document the non-standard methods, too. This gets rid of the mixin pages for a start.
items.title: Move DocumentOrShadowRoot.element(s)FromPoint to Document.element(s)FromPoint

items.content_html:
Again, we should avoid documenting this under the DocumentOrShadowRoot mixin.

Move https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentOrShadowRoot/caretPositionFromPoint to
http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/caretPositionFromPoint

Spec: https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom-view/#extensions-to-the-document-interface

Firefox considers this for ShadowRoot in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1430307 but there is no implementation or spec for it. If it ever happens, new docs should be written for ShadowRoot.caretPositionFromPoint and until then it is best to just have docs under Document.caretPositionFromPoint

BCD: mdn/browser-compat-data#9439
items.title: Move caretPositionFromPoint to Document

items.content_html: This relates to mdn/yari#3177 and using that new flaw checker in the content CI.

items.content_html:
Another of the Trusted Type API interfaces. This time TrustedTypePolicy.

Spec: https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-trusted-types/dist/spec/#trusted-type-policy

Reviewer: @jpmedley
items.title: Adds TrustedTypePolicy API

items.content_html: This includes a few changes to the word 'favorite' because they were part of the same keyword or identifier is the primary issue of this PR.
items.title: Change spelling of 'color' to American spelling

items.content_html:
Working on documenting the Trusted Types API. This PR adds:

  • TrustedHTML
  • TrustedScript
  • TrustedScriptURL

Spec: https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-trusted-types/dist/spec/

Reviewer: @jpmedley

To save yourself some time Joe, these are all pretty much the same as each other so if you want to snag TrustedHTML and the two method pages, I will then apply any changes to the others.

Also, it looks as if toJSON() is only in Canary (I tested it), and we have no BCD for the method. So that will need adding, which I can do if it is going to land.
items.title: Adds TrustedHTML, TrustedScript, TrustedScriptURL

items.title: Add a case to the warning

items.content_html:
1. Firefox 87 caps Mac OS X version at 10.15. This change was made in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1679929 to work around webcompat problems from websites that broke when the User-Agent string reported "Mac OS X 11.0". Safari also caps the reported Mac OS X version at 10.15 and Chrome plans to cap soon, too.
  2. Firefox no longer supports PPC Mac OS X, so remove mention of PPC Mac OS X.
items.title: Update Firefox User-Agent string reference for Mac OS X
